prerequisites: Placement test score qualifying for MATH 109 or higher
COSC_111.description: Introduction to programming using a high-level language. Topics include problem solving, algorithm development, data types, control structures, functions, arrays, and basic object-oriented concepts.

prerequisites: COSC 111 with grade of C or better
recommended_background: Strong understanding of basic programming concepts
COSC_112.description: Continuation of Programming I. Advanced programming concepts including classes, inheritance, polymorphism, file I/O, exception handling, and introduction to data structures.

prerequisites: COSC 112 with grade of C or better
recommended_background: Strong programming skills in an object-oriented language
COSC_211.description: Study of fundamental data structures including arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Analysis of algorithms and their implementation.

prerequisites: COSC 112 with grade of C or better
COSC_225.description: Introduction to computer organization and architecture. Topics include digital logic, processor design, memory hierarchy, and assembly language programming.

prerequisites: COSC 211 with grade of C or better
COSC_231.description: Mathematical analysis of computer algorithms. Topics include asymptotic notation, complexity analysis, sorting and searching algorithms, and graph algorithms.

prerequisites: COSC 211 with grade of C or better
COSC_280.description: Principles and practices of software engineering. Topics include software lifecycle, requirements analysis, design patterns, testing, and project management.

prerequisites: COSC 211 with grade of C or better
COSC_310.description: Database design and implementation. Topics include relational model, SQL, normalization, transaction processing, and database administration.

COSC_315.description: Operating system concepts including process management, memory management, file systems, and I/O systems. Hands-on experience with system calls and kernel programming.

recommended_background: Basic knowledge of probability and statistics
COSC_320.description: Computer network architecture and protocols. Topics include TCP/IP, routing algorithms, network security, and distributed systems.

COSC_330.description: Study of programming language concepts including syntax, semantics, data types, control structures, and language paradigms.

COSC_340.description: Introduction to artificial intelligence including search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and expert systems.

recommended_background: Strong mathematical background in linear algebra
COSC_350.description: Computer graphics principles including 2D and 3D transformations, rendering algorithms, shading models, and graphics programming.

COSC_360.description: Introduction to cybersecurity including cryptography, network security, system security, and security policies.

prerequisites: Completion of core computer science courses
COSC_400.description: First part of senior capstone project. Students work in teams to design and begin implementation of a significant software project.

prerequisites: COSC 400 (Senior Capstone I) with grade of C or better
recommended_background: Completion of capstone project design phase
COSC_401.description: Continuation of senior capstone project. Students complete implementation, testing, and documentation of their software project.

MATH_152.description: Differential calculus of functions of one variable

prerequisites: MATH 152 with grade of C or better
MATH 153 with grade of C or better
MATH 153 with grade of C or better
MATH_254.description: First and second order differential equations

MATH_295.description: Logic, set theory, combinatorics, graph theory, and mathematical proof techniques

important_notes.minimum_grade_policy: A grade of C or better is required in COSC 111, 112, and 211 to continue in the program
important_notes.math_placement: Students must take a placement test or have appropriate transfer credits for mathematics courses
important_notes.course_sequencing: Courses must be taken in the proper sequence due to prerequisite requirements
important_notes.override_requests: Students needing prerequisite overrides must petition the department with justification
